Limited resources: Developing countries may not have the financial resources to invest in clean water initiatives, which can make it difficult to implement and maintain these initiatives.

Lack of awareness: Many people in developing countries may not be aware of the importance of clean water or how to access it safely. This can lead to poor hygiene practices and an increased risk of waterborne diseases.
Contamination: Developing countries may have limited regulations and enforcement of water quality standards, which can lead to contamination of water sources.
Limited access to education: Many people in developing countries may not have access to education about the importance of clean water and how to access it safely.
Limited access to healthcare: People in developing countries may not have access to healthcare services that can help them prevent and treat waterborne diseases.
